medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was in his usual state of health until the afternoon when he developed worsening jaundice. Over the weekend, he experienced worsening anorexia and on the latest noted date, he developed a fever of 103Â°F and vomiting once. His family noted he became very fatigued with chills. He did not report any abdominal pain. He presented with initial hypoxia and chest clutching.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Alzheimer's disease, coronary artery disease (CAD), systolic congestive heart failure (CHF) with an ejection fraction of 35%, sick sinus syndrome (SSS) status post pacemaker implantation, recently diagnosed cholangiocarcinoma status post biliary stent, history of transient ischemic attack (TIA), status post four-vessel coronary artery bypass graft (CABG), status post abdominal aortic aneurysm (AAA) repair, hypertension, hyperlipidemia, history of gastrointestinal bleeding (GIB), thrombocytopenia, osteoarthritis.
